trans-unit.source: Specifies a configuration element that causes a channel to transfer messages on the peer transport when it is included in a custom binding.
This class cannot be inherited.
This configuration element allows you to create a custom binding that implements the peer transport protocol.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.PeerTransportElement"></xref> class.
Applies the settings of the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement"></xref> to this configuration element.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement"></xref> whose settings are to be applied to this configuration element.
Gets the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> object that represents the custom binding element.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> object that represents the custom binding element.
Copies the settings from the specified configuration element to this configuration element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionElement"></xref> that contains the configuration element whose settings are to be copied to this configuration element section.
Creates a binding element from the settings in this configuration element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement"></xref> whose properties are copied from the settings in this configuration element.
Initializes this peer transport binding configuration section with the content of the specified binding element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement"></xref> to use for initializing this binging configuration instance.
Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the IP address upon which the peer transport listens.
If this property is not set, or is set to a null reference, the associated <xref:System.ServiceModel.PeerNode> listens on all global addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6) configured for the local machine.
A <xref href="System.Net.IPAddress"></xref> that contains the IP address upon which the peer transport listens.
Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the maximum size of the TCP message buffer pool, in bytes.
If you receive more data than you can buffer, the data that exceeds the buffer size remains on the underlying socket until your buffer has room for the rest of the data.
A <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> that specifies the maximum size of the TCP message buffer pool, in bytes.
The default value is 524,288 bytes.
Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the maximum size, in bytes, for TCP messages received by the peer binding.
A <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the maximum size in bytes of TCP messages received over the peer channels created by this binding.
The default value is 65,536 (64 KB).
Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the port for the peer transport binding.
If the port value is invalid, <xref:System.ArgumentException> is raised.
The default value for this property is 0, which indicates that the listener port is randomly selected from all unreserved ports.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that specifies the port for the peer transport binding.

Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection"></xref> instance that contains a collection of <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty"></xref> objects that can be attributes or <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> objects of this configuration element.

A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection"></xref> instance that contains a collection of <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty"></xref> objects that can be attributes or <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> objects of this configuration element.
Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the security to set on peer channels created by this binding.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.PeerSecuritySettings"></xref> enumeration value that indicates the security to set on peer channels created by this binding.
Security can be either message- or transport-specific.
